artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōhashiya Yashichi
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 220 [unlisted]; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 286 [unlisted]
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: ink drawing with blue, red, brown, yellow and green; two fighting men, foreshortened; man on top is bare chested and wears a blue skirt, holding his PL lower leg across stomach of other man, and holding other man's neck in his PL hand; man on bottom wears brown, yellow and red helmet, red garment with yellow designs, and green boots with brown soles; snow covered tree at left; attached to off-white mount sheet
medium: Preparatory drawing for a print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Heroes of the ‘Tales of the Water Margin’ (Gōketsu suikoden 豪傑水滸傳)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: The Boatman Zhang Heng
